page.title: 01FARMING LAND SOUTH OF EYE
page.content: The block is an active farming area, very lightly wooded with few hedges and generally scattered houses. The landscape is flat giving open views over considerable distances. Production is largely cereals, sugar beet, rape, peas and beans, and a small number if intensively reared cattle. The villages of Bedingfield, Rishangles and Southolt are small and scattered. Most people are directly ot indirectly engaged in agriculture, a few work outside the area and of the retired people most are local, but a few have come from outside. There are no schools, two small shops, one pub and of the three churches, Southolt and Rishangles are closed. Services are held at Bedingfield and also at the Baptist chapel at Rishangles. Since most households have at least one car, there is a tendancy for many
